# Comparative CT methods  
## Double delta CT  

$$
\Delta\Delta C_T = \Delta C_{T,q} - \Delta C_{T,cb}
$$

$$
2^{-\Delta\Delta C_T}
$$

$$
s = \sqrt{s_1^2 + s_2^2}
$$

```{r ddct_average_ct}
# default mode delta_delta_ct
## locate and read raw ct data
fl <- system.file('extdata', 'ct1.csv', package = 'pcr')
ct1 <- readr::read_csv(fl)

## add grouping variable
group_var <- rep(c('brain', 'kidney'), each = 6)

# calculate all values and errors in one step
## mode == 'average_ct' default
pcr_analyze(ct1,
  group_var = group_var,
  reference_gene = 'GAPDH',
  reference_group = 'brain')
```

## Delata CT   

```{r}
# delta_ct method
## example to check fold change of control gens
## locate and read file
fl <- system.file('extdata', 'ct1.csv', package = 'pcr')
ct1 <- readr::read_csv(fl)

## make a data.frame of two identical columns
pcr_hk <- data.frame(
  GAPDH1 = ct1$GAPDH,
  GAPDH2 = ct1$GAPDH
  )

## add grouping variable
group_var <- rep(c('brain', 'kidney'), each = 6)

## calculate caliberation
pcr_analyze(pcr_hk,
            group_var = group_var,
            reference_group = 'brain',
            method = 'delta_ct')
```


# statndard curve methods  
$$
\log amount = \dfrac{C_T - b}{m}
$$

$$
10^{\log amount}
$$

$$
cv = \sqrt{cv_1^2 + cv_2^2}
$$

$$
s = (cv)(\bar X)
$$

```{r calculating curve}
# relative standard curve method
## locate and read data
fl <- system.file('extdata', 'pcr_dilute.csv', package = 'pcr')
pcr_dilute <- readr::read_csv(fl)

## make a vector of RNA amounts
amount <- rep(c(1, .5, .2, .1, .05, .02, .01), each = 3)

## calculate standard curve
standard_curve <- pcr_assess(pcr_dilute,
                             amount = amount,
                             mode = 'standard_curve')
intercept <- standard_curve$intercept
slope <- standard_curve$slope
```
